messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] two math mistakes (not mine this  time!
messages.msgSnippet: ... oh man, did you hafta go talk about Taco Sal s. For those not in the know, taco Sal was a hole in the wall New Mexican food place that was just to die
messages.messageBody:
Danielle E. Conger wrote:

> At 12:43 PM 11/14/2003 -0500, Sandra wrote:
> >They just said the NM 4th graders are in 50th place in the US with their
> >math scores.
>
>
> We lived in Albuquerque for two years, and that is where I cemented my
> conviction to homeschool for this very reason! Though at that time
> (1999-2001) I believe NM was ranked 47, still tying with Missippi or
> Kentucky or some such state.
>
> I loved Albuquerque, though, and would have stayed if things had
> worked out
> that way. I still miss Taco Sal's chili rellenos!

oh man, did you hafta go talk about Taco Sal's.

For those not in the know, taco Sal was a hole in the wall New Mexican
food place that was just to die for....

I hear they aren't so good now... they changed owners or something.

Joylyn

>
>
> --danielle, drooling fondly over the memory of tasty, roasted green Hatch
> chilis
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] two math mistakes (not mine this  time!
messages.msgSnippet: ... We lived in Albuquerque for two years, and that is where I cemented my conviction to homeschool for this very reason! Though at that time (1999-2001) I
messages.messageBody:
At 12:43 PM 11/14/2003 -0500, Sandra wrote:
>They just said the NM 4th graders are in 50th place in the US with their
>math scores.


We lived in Albuquerque for two years, and that is where I cemented my
conviction to homeschool for this very reason! Though at that time
(1999-2001) I believe NM was ranked 47, still tying with Missippi or
Kentucky or some such state.

I loved Albuquerque, though, and would have stayed if things had worked out
that way. I still miss Taco Sal's chili rellenos!

--danielle, drooling fondly over the memory of tasty, roasted green Hatch
chilis

messages.subject: two math mistakes (not mine this time!
messages.messageBody:
<< The list has steadily been growing since Sandra and Joyce and I
took over ownership and we're up to over 1700 people >>

Typo or mixed up with another group.
We have 1272 So there's a 7, that's true. <g>

It's enough to have good discussions, either way, definitely.

And this is an embarrassment for New Mexico. In the words of a homeschooling
mom local to me:
===================
They just said the NM 4th graders are in 50th place in the US with their

math scores. They showed the number 50 very large on the screen.


They tied for 50th with Mississippi........


Is it any wonder!?!?!?!!?!


I think this is so damn funny but sad.... not the scores, the 50th

statement.


OMG! LOL


Mel
==================

I can see tying for 49th...
But HOW can we tie for 50th? (Maybe Puerto Rico scored better and they're in
there...)

Sandra
